# Parameter Specification: [ModuleName]

**CRITICAL CONTRACT:** This specification is immutable during Stages 2-5 implementation. All DSP and panel design reference this exact specification.

**Generated by:** Stage 1 Planning (after creative brief and architecture)
**Referenced by:** Stage 3 (Panel Design), Stage 4 (DSP Implementation), Stage 5 (Assembly)
**Purpose:** Complete specification of all module parameters, I/O ports, lights, and panel layout positions

---

## Panel Dimensions

**HP Width:** [X] HP
**Width (mm):** [X * 5.08] mm
**Height (mm):** 128.5 mm (Eurorack standard)
**ViewBox:** `0 0 [X * 5.08] 128.5` (SVG coordinate system)

**Example:**
```markdown
**HP Width:** 10 HP
**Width (mm):** 50.80 mm
**Height (mm):** 128.5 mm (Eurorack standard)
**ViewBox:** `0 0 50.80 128.5` (SVG coordinate system)
```

---

## Component Color Codes (SVG)

**Critical for helper.py automation:**

| Color | Hex Code | Component Type | Usage |
|-------|----------|----------------|-------|
| Red | `#ff0000` | Parameters | Knobs, switches, buttons |
| Green | `#00ff00` | Inputs | Input ports (audio, CV, gate) |
| Blue | `#0000ff` | Outputs | Output ports (audio, CV, gate) |
| Magenta | `#ff00ff` | Lights | LEDs, indicators |
| Yellow | `#ffff00` | Custom Widgets | Displays, scopes, custom UI (optional) |

**Notes:**
- Component layer must be named "components" in SVG
- Component IDs in SVG become enum names in C++ (e.g., "freq-knob" → FREQ_KNOB_PARAM)
- Colors must be exact (case-insensitive but exact RGB values)
- Hide component layer before exporting final SVG (visual only)

---

## Parameters (Knobs, Switches, Buttons)

[Table of all user-controllable parameters]

| ID | Label | Type | Range | Default | Unit | Position (mm) | CV Input? | Notes |
|----|-------|------|-------|---------|------|---------------|-----------|-------|
| [PARAM_ID] | [Label] | [Knob/Switch/Button] | [Min-Max] | [Default] | [Unit] | (x, y) | [Yes/No] | [Special notes] |

**Component Types:**
- **Knob**: Continuous rotary control (RoundBlackKnob, RoundSmallBlackKnob, Davies1900hBlackKnob, etc.)
- **Switch**: Toggle or multi-position switch (CKSS, CKD6, NKK, etc.)
- **Button**: Momentary or latching button (VCVButton, LEDButton, etc.)

**Position Coordinates:**
- Origin (0, 0) = top-left corner of panel
- X increases rightward, Y increases downward
- Units: millimeters (mm)
- Centered on component (not top-left)

**Example:**
```markdown
| ID | Label | Type | Range | Default | Unit | Position (mm) | CV Input? | Notes |
|----|-------|------|-------|---------|------|---------------|-----------|-------|
| TIME_PARAM | TIME | Knob (large) | 10ms - 1s | 250ms | ms | (25.4, 20.0) | Yes (TIME_CV) | Logarithmic scaling |
| FEEDBACK_PARAM | FEEDBACK | Knob (large) | 0 - 120% | 50% | % | (25.4, 40.0) | Yes (FEEDBACK_CV) | >100% = self-oscillation |
| MIX_PARAM | MIX | Knob (medium) | 0 - 100% | 50% | % | (25.4, 60.0) | No | Dry/wet balance |
| TONE_PARAM | TONE | Knob (medium) | -100 to +100 | -30 | - | (25.4, 75.0) | No | Bipolar (- = dark, + = bright) |
| WOW_PARAM | WOW | Knob (small) | 0 - 100% | 0% | % | (15.0, 90.0) | No | Slow tape flutter |
| FLUTTER_PARAM | FLUTTER | Knob (small) | 0 - 100% | 0% | % | (35.0, 90.0) | No | Fast tape flutter |
| PINGPONG_PARAM | PING-PONG | Switch (CKSS) | 0/1 | 0 | - | (25.4, 105.0) | No | Off = mono, On = stereo |
```

**Parameter Scaling:**
- **Linear**: Direct mapping (e.g., MIX 0-100% → 0.0-1.0)
- **Logarithmic**: Exponential scaling (e.g., TIME 10ms-1s → use log scale for even perceived spacing)
- **Bipolar**: Centered at zero (e.g., TONE -100 to +100 → -1.0 to +1.0)

**Parameter Value Formulas:**
```markdown
**TIME (logarithmic):**
- Param value: 0.0 to 1.0
- Display value: `10ms * exp(value * log(100))` (10ms at 0.0, 1000ms at 1.0)
- Use in DSP: `delayTime = 0.010 * exp(params[TIME_PARAM].getValue() * log(100.0))`

**FEEDBACK (linear with overdrive):**
- Param value: 0.0 to 1.2 (0-120%)
- Display value: `value * 100` (0% to 120%)
- Use in DSP: `feedbackGain = params[FEEDBACK_PARAM].getValue()`

**TONE (bipolar):**
- Param value: -1.0 to +1.0
- Display value: `value * 100` (-100 to +100)
- Use in DSP: `toneValue = params[TONE_PARAM].getValue()` (negative = LP, positive = HP)
```

---

## Inputs (Audio, CV, Gate, Trigger)

[Table of all input ports]

| ID | Label | Type | Voltage Range | Position (mm) | Polyphonic? | Normalization | Notes |
|----|-------|------|--------------|---------------|-------------|---------------|-------|
| [INPUT_ID] | [Label] | [Audio/CV/Gate/Trigger] | [Range] | (x, y) | [Yes/No] | [Normal behavior] | [Special notes] |

**Input Types:**
- **Audio**: Audio-rate signals (±5V standard, ±10V accepted)
- **CV**: Control voltage (±5V standard for bipolar, 0-10V for unipolar)
- **Gate**: Binary signal (>1V = high, <1V = low)
- **Trigger**: Rising-edge event (0V → >1V transition)

**Polyphonic:**
- Yes = accepts up to 16 channels, processes per-channel
- No = monophonic only (channel 0), broadcasts to all channels if needed

**Normalization:**
- None = input must be patched to function
- Internal = normalized to internal signal (e.g., feedback path)
- Value = normalized to fixed voltage (e.g., 0V, 5V)

**Example:**
```markdown
| ID | Label | Type | Voltage Range | Position (mm) | Polyphonic? | Normalization | Notes |
|----|-------|------|--------------|---------------|-------------|---------------|-------|
| IN_INPUT | IN | Audio | ±5V (±10V OK) | (10.0, 20.0) | Yes (1-16 ch) | None | Main audio input |
| TIME_CV_INPUT | TIME CV | CV | ±5V | (10.0, 35.0) | Yes/No (both OK) | None | 1V = ~100ms shift |
| FEEDBACK_CV_INPUT | FEEDBACK CV | CV | ±5V | (10.0, 50.0) | Yes/No (both OK) | None | 1V = 20% shift |
| FREEZE_INPUT | FREEZE | Gate | 0-10V | (10.0, 65.0) | No (mono) | None | High = freeze buffer |
| EXT_FB_INPUT | EXT FB | Audio | ±5V (±10V OK) | (10.0, 80.0) | Yes (1-16 ch) | Internal feedback | Replaces feedback when patched |
```

**Input Behavior:**
```markdown
**TIME_CV:**
- Summed with TIME_PARAM: `totalTime = baseTime + (cv * 0.1s)`
- Clamped to 10ms-1s range
- When FEEDBACK ≥ 90%, uses 1V/oct scaling instead of linear

**FEEDBACK_CV:**
- Summed with FEEDBACK_PARAM: `totalFeedback = baseFeedback + (cv * 0.2)`
- Clamped to 0-120% range (0.0-1.2)
- Bipolar modulation (±5V = ±100%)

**FREEZE:**
- Gate input (Schmitt trigger, 0.5V hysteresis)
- High (>1V) = freeze buffer (stop writes, continue reads)
- Low (<1V) = unfreeze (resume normal operation)
- Used for infinite sustain effects

**EXT_FB:**
- Normalized to internal feedback (delay output → feedback input)
- When patched, breaks normalization (external signal used instead)
- Check with `inputs[EXT_FB_INPUT].isConnected()`
```

---

## Outputs (Audio, CV, Gate, Trigger)

[Table of all output ports]

| ID | Label | Type | Voltage Range | Position (mm) | Polyphonic? | Source | Notes |
|----|-------|------|--------------|---------------|-------------|--------|-------|
| [OUTPUT_ID] | [Label] | [Audio/CV/Gate/Trigger] | [Range] | (x, y) | [Yes/No] | [What it outputs] | [Special notes] |

**Example:**
```markdown
| ID | Label | Type | Voltage Range | Position (mm) | Polyphonic? | Source | Notes |
|----|-------|------|--------------|---------------|-------------|--------|-------|
| OUT_L_OUTPUT | OUT L | Audio | ±5V (soft clip ±6V) | (40.0, 20.0) | Yes (matches input) | Left/mono delay output | Mono when ping-pong off |
| OUT_R_OUTPUT | OUT R | Audio | ±5V (soft clip ±6V) | (40.0, 35.0) | Yes (matches input) | Right delay output | Copy of L when ping-pong off |
| DRY_OUTPUT | DRY | Audio | ±5V (matches input) | (40.0, 50.0) | Yes (matches input) | Buffered input signal | For parallel processing |
```

**Output Behavior:**
```markdown
**OUT_L / OUT_R:**
- Channel count matches IN input (call setChannels())
- When PING_PONG = Off: OUT_L = OUT_R (mono, both outputs identical)
- When PING_PONG = On: Alternating delays (L → R → L → R)
- Soft clipping at ±6V (prevents extreme feedback runaway)

**DRY:**
- Direct copy of IN input (no processing)
- Same channel count as IN
- Used for parallel wet/dry mixing (external to module)
```

---

## Lights (LEDs, Indicators)

[Table of all visual indicators]

| ID | Label | Type | Color(s) | Position (mm) | Brightness Control | Notes |
|----|-------|------|----------|---------------|-------------------|-------|
| [LIGHT_ID] | [Label] | [LED type] | [Color] | (x, y) | [How brightness is set] | [Special notes] |

**Light Types:**
- **Single LED**: One color (RedLight, GreenLight, BlueLight, etc.)
- **RGB LED**: Full RGB control (RedGreenBlueLight)
- **Bi-color LED**: Two colors (e.g., RedGreenLight for level meters)

**Brightness Control:**
- 0.0 = off, 1.0 = full brightness
- Use `lights[LIGHT_ID].setBrightness(value)`
- For RGB: `setBrightness(red, green, blue)` or `setBrightnessSmooth(red, green, blue, deltaTime)`

**Example:**
```markdown
| ID | Label | Type | Color(s) | Position (mm) | Brightness Control | Notes |
|----|-------|------|----------|---------------|-------------------|-------|
| CLIP_LIGHT | CLIP | Single LED | Red | (25.4, 115.0) | Saturation level (0.0-1.0) | Tracks tape saturation |
| PING_LIGHT | PING | Bi-color LED | Green/Red | (25.4, 107.0) | Alternates with delay timing | Green = L, Red = R |
```

**Light Behavior:**
```markdown
**CLIP_LIGHT:**
- Brightness = saturation amount (0.0 = no saturation, 1.0 = full saturation)
- Calculated from feedback level: `brightness = max(0.0, (feedback - 0.8) * 5.0)`
- Updated every process() call: `lights[CLIP_LIGHT].setBrightness(brightness)`
- Visual feedback for dialing in saturation amount

**PING_LIGHT:**
- Bi-color LED (green/red)
- Green = left channel delay active
- Red = right channel delay active
- Alternates with ping-pong timing (visual metronome)
- Only active when PING_PONG = On
```

---

## CV Modulation Matrix

[Which parameters accept CV input, and how they interact]

| Parameter | CV Input | Polyphonic CV? | Voltage to Effect Mapping | Clamping | Notes |
|-----------|----------|---------------|---------------------------|----------|-------|
| [PARAM] | [INPUT] | [Yes/No] | [Formula] | [Min/Max] | [Special behavior] |

**Example:**
```markdown
| Parameter | CV Input | Polyphonic CV? | Voltage to Effect Mapping | Clamping | Notes |
|-----------|----------|---------------|---------------------------|----------|-------|
| TIME | TIME_CV | Yes/No (both) | `time += cv * 100ms` (1V = 100ms) | 10ms - 1s | Linear scaling normally, 1V/oct when FEEDBACK ≥ 90% |
| FEEDBACK | FEEDBACK_CV | Yes/No (both) | `fb += cv * 0.2` (1V = 20%) | 0 - 120% | Bipolar modulation, can push into self-oscillation |
| MIX | N/A | N/A | N/A | N/A | No CV input (manual control only) |
| TONE | N/A | N/A | N/A | N/A | No CV input (manual control only) |
| WOW | N/A | N/A | N/A | N/A | No CV input (manual control only) |
| FLUTTER | N/A | N/A | N/A | N/A | No CV input (manual control only) |
```

**Polyphonic CV Behavior:**
- If CV input is monophonic (1 channel): Broadcast to all channels (global modulation)
- If CV input is polyphonic (2-16 channels): Per-channel modulation (independent control)
- Formula: `int cvChannels = inputs[CV_INPUT].getChannels(); float cv = inputs[CV_INPUT].getVoltage(min(c, cvChannels - 1));`

**Special Cases:**
- **TIME_CV with 1V/oct**: When FEEDBACK ≥ 90%, TIME_CV switches from linear (1V = 100ms) to exponential (1V = 1 octave). This enables pitched self-oscillation tracking keyboard/sequencer CV.
- **FEEDBACK_CV with polyphony**: Each channel can have independent feedback control, enabling per-voice feedback modulation (useful for polyphonic sequences).

---

## Panel Layout Guide

### Component Grouping

[Logical grouping of controls for intuitive layout]

**Example:**
```markdown
**Top Section (0-40mm from top):**
- Primary controls: TIME, FEEDBACK knobs (large, prominent)
- Associated CV inputs below each knob

**Middle Section (40-80mm from top):**
- Secondary controls: MIX, TONE knobs (medium size)
- Main audio input (IN) and outputs (OUT L, OUT R)

**Bottom Section (80-128.5mm from top):**
- Tertiary controls: WOW, FLUTTER knobs (small, less frequently adjusted)
- Mode switches: PING-PONG switch
- Utility outputs: DRY output
- Visual feedback: CLIP light, PING light
```

### Visual Hierarchy

[Size and prominence guidelines]

**Example:**
```markdown
**Large Knobs (12mm diameter):**
- Primary controls used most frequently
- Examples: TIME, FEEDBACK

**Medium Knobs (9mm diameter):**
- Secondary controls used regularly
- Examples: MIX, TONE

**Small Knobs (6mm diameter):**
- Tertiary controls used occasionally
- Examples: WOW, FLUTTER

**Switches:**
- CKSS (3-position toggle): Mode switches
- CKD6 (2-position toggle): On/off switches
- NKK (illuminated toggle): Emphasized mode switches
```

### Spacing Guidelines

[Minimum spacing between components to prevent crowding]

**Example:**
```markdown
**Knob-to-knob spacing:**
- Large knobs: 15mm minimum (20mm comfortable)
- Medium knobs: 12mm minimum (15mm comfortable)
- Small knobs: 10mm minimum (12mm comfortable)

**Port-to-port spacing:**
- Input/output jacks: 10mm minimum (12mm comfortable)
- Port-to-knob: 8mm minimum (prevents accidental contact)

**Edge margins:**
- Top margin: 10mm (prevents crowding panel edge)
- Bottom margin: 10mm
- Side margins: 3mm (minimal, HP width is constrained)

**Alignment:**
- Align components vertically when possible (creates visual order)
- Center components horizontally within HP width (balanced appearance)
```

### Label Placement

[Where to place text labels relative to components]

**Example:**
```markdown
**Knob labels:**
- Above knob: 2-3mm clearance (preferred for top/middle section)
- Below knob: 2-3mm clearance (used when space above is limited)
- Font size: 3-4mm height (readable at typical viewing distance)

**Port labels:**
- Above port: 2mm clearance (standard)
- Font size: 2.5-3mm height (smaller than knob labels)

**Light labels:**
- Adjacent to LED: 2mm clearance (left or right side)
- Font size: 2-2.5mm height (smallest text)

**Typography:**
- Use sans-serif font (Helvetica, Arial, or VCV Rack default)
- All caps for primary labels (TIME, FEEDBACK)
- Mixed case for secondary labels (if needed)
```

---

## SVG Component Layer Structure

[How to structure the SVG for helper.py automation]

**Example SVG structure:**
```xml
<svg
   width="50.80mm"
   height="128.5mm"
   viewBox="0 0 50.80 128.5"
   xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">

  <!-- Background layer (visible in panel) -->
  <g id="background">
    <rect width="50.80" height="128.5" fill="#222222" />
    <!-- Panel graphics, labels, artwork -->
  </g>

  <!-- Component layer (HIDDEN in final SVG, used by helper.py) -->
  <g id="components" style="display:none">

    <!-- Parameters (RED) -->
    <circle id="time-knob" cx="25.4" cy="20.0" r="2" fill="#ff0000" />
    <circle id="feedback-knob" cx="25.4" cy="40.0" r="2" fill="#ff0000" />
    <circle id="mix-knob" cx="25.4" cy="60.0" r="2" fill="#ff0000" />
    <circle id="tone-knob" cx="25.4" cy="75.0" r="2" fill="#ff0000" />
    <circle id="wow-knob" cx="15.0" cy="90.0" r="1" fill="#ff0000" />
    <circle id="flutter-knob" cx="35.0" cy="90.0" r="1" fill="#ff0000" />
    <rect id="pingpong-switch" x="24.0" y="103.0" width="2.8" height="4" fill="#ff0000" />

    <!-- Inputs (GREEN) -->
    <circle id="in-input" cx="10.0" cy="20.0" r="2" fill="#00ff00" />
    <circle id="time-cv-input" cx="10.0" cy="35.0" r="2" fill="#00ff00" />
    <circle id="feedback-cv-input" cx="10.0" cy="50.0" r="2" fill="#00ff00" />
    <circle id="freeze-input" cx="10.0" cy="65.0" r="2" fill="#00ff00" />
    <circle id="ext-fb-input" cx="10.0" cy="80.0" r="2" fill="#00ff00" />

    <!-- Outputs (BLUE) -->
    <circle id="out-l-output" cx="40.0" cy="20.0" r="2" fill="#0000ff" />
    <circle id="out-r-output" cx="40.0" cy="35.0" r="2" fill="#0000ff" />
    <circle id="dry-output" cx="40.0" cy="50.0" r="2" fill="#0000ff" />

    <!-- Lights (MAGENTA) -->
    <circle id="clip-light" cx="25.4" cy="115.0" r="1" fill="#ff00ff" />
    <circle id="ping-light" cx="25.4" cy="107.0" r="1" fill="#ff00ff" />

  </g>

</svg>
```

**Notes:**
- Component IDs use kebab-case (e.g., "time-knob") → helper.py converts to UPPER_SNAKE_CASE (e.g., TIME_KNOB_PARAM)
- Component layer must be hidden (`display:none`) before exporting final SVG
- Position (cx, cy) or (x, y) determines mm2px() coordinates in C++
- Circle radius (r) is arbitrary (not used by helper.py, visual guide only)
- Helper.py reads component color to determine type (param/input/output/light)

---

## Helper.py Code Generation

**Command:**
```bash
cd modules/[PluginName]/
$RACK_DIR/helper.py createmodule [ModuleName] res/[ModuleName].svg src/[ModuleName].cpp
```

**Generated Enums (from SVG component IDs):**
```cpp
enum ParamId {
    TIME_PARAM,
    FEEDBACK_PARAM,
    MIX_PARAM,
    TONE_PARAM,
    WOW_PARAM,
    FLUTTER_PARAM,
    PINGPONG_PARAM,
    PARAMS_LEN
};

enum InputId {
    IN_INPUT,
    TIME_CV_INPUT,
    FEEDBACK_CV_INPUT,
    FREEZE_INPUT,
    EXT_FB_INPUT,
    INPUTS_LEN
};

enum OutputId {
    OUT_L_OUTPUT,
    OUT_R_OUTPUT,
    DRY_OUTPUT,
    OUTPUTS_LEN
};

enum LightId {
    CLIP_LIGHT,
    PING_LIGHT,
    LIGHTS_LEN
};
```

**Generated Widget Code (from SVG positions):**
```cpp
struct TapeDelayWidget : ModuleWidget {
    TapeDelayWidget(TapeDelay* module) {
        setModule(module);
        setPanel(createPanel(asset::plugin(pluginInstance, "res/TapeDelay.svg")));

        // Parameters (RED components)
        addParam(createParamCentered<RoundBlackKnob>(mm2px(Vec(25.4, 20.0)), module, TapeDelay::TIME_PARAM));
        addParam(createParamCentered<RoundBlackKnob>(mm2px(Vec(25.4, 40.0)), module, TapeDelay::FEEDBACK_PARAM));
        addParam(createParamCentered<RoundBlackKnob>(mm2px(Vec(25.4, 60.0)), module, TapeDelay::MIX_PARAM));
        // ... etc ...

        // Inputs (GREEN components)
        addInput(createInputCentered<PJ301MPort>(mm2px(Vec(10.0, 20.0)), module, TapeDelay::IN_INPUT));
        addInput(createInputCentered<PJ301MPort>(mm2px(Vec(10.0, 35.0)), module, TapeDelay::TIME_CV_INPUT));
        // ... etc ...

        // Outputs (BLUE components)
        addOutput(createOutputCentered<PJ301MPort>(mm2px(Vec(40.0, 20.0)), module, TapeDelay::OUT_L_OUTPUT));
        addOutput(createOutputCentered<PJ301MPort>(mm2px(Vec(40.0, 35.0)), module, TapeDelay::OUT_R_OUTPUT));
        // ... etc ...

        // Lights (MAGENTA components)
        addChild(createLightCentered<MediumLight<RedLight>>(mm2px(Vec(25.4, 115.0)), module, TapeDelay::CLIP_LIGHT));
        addChild(createLightCentered<MediumLight<GreenRedLight>>(mm2px(Vec(25.4, 107.0)), module, TapeDelay::PING_LIGHT));
    }
};
```

---

## Implementation Checklist

- [ ] All parameter IDs, ranges, defaults, and units specified
- [ ] All input IDs, types, voltage ranges, and polyphony specified
- [ ] All output IDs, types, voltage ranges, and polyphony specified
- [ ] All light IDs, colors, and brightness control specified
- [ ] CV modulation matrix complete (which params accept CV)
- [ ] Panel dimensions correct (HP × 5.08mm width, 128.5mm height)
- [ ] Component positions specified in millimeters (mm)
- [ ] SVG component color codes correct (#ff0000, #00ff00, #0000ff, #ff00ff)
- [ ] Component spacing meets minimum guidelines (no crowding)
- [ ] Visual hierarchy clear (large/medium/small knobs)
- [ ] Logical grouping of controls (top/middle/bottom sections)
- [ ] Labels readable (font size 2.5-4mm)
- [ ] SVG component layer structure correct (helper.py compatible)

---

## Validation Tests

### Parameter Tests

- [ ] All parameter ranges match creative brief and architecture
- [ ] Default values are sensible (safe starting point)
- [ ] Logarithmic/bipolar scaling matches intended behavior
- [ ] CV modulation works correctly (voltage to effect mapping)
- [ ] Polyphonic CV broadcasts or per-channel as specified

### I/O Tests

- [ ] All inputs accept expected voltage ranges
- [ ] All outputs generate expected voltage ranges
- [ ] Polyphony propagates correctly (input channels → output channels)
- [ ] Normalization works as specified (e.g., EXT_FB → internal feedback)
- [ ] Gate/trigger inputs use correct thresholds (>1V = high)

### Panel Tests

- [ ] All components visible and accessible (no overlaps)
- [ ] Knobs have sufficient clearance for finger adjustment
- [ ] Ports have sufficient clearance for cable plugging
- [ ] Labels are readable at typical viewing distance
- [ ] Visual hierarchy guides user to primary controls first

### SVG Tests

- [ ] Panel dimensions exact (HP × 5.08mm width, 128.5mm height)
- [ ] ViewBox correct (`0 0 [width] 128.5`)
- [ ] Component layer present and named "components"
- [ ] Component colors exact (#ff0000, #00ff00, #0000ff, #ff00ff)
- [ ] Component IDs use kebab-case (e.g., "time-knob")
- [ ] Component layer hidden before export (`display:none`)

---

**Example:**
```markdown
| Date | Version | Changes | Author |
|------|---------|---------|--------|
| 2025-11-12 | 1.0 | Initial parameter specification | Claude |
| 2025-11-13 | 1.1 | Added FREEZE gate input | User |
```

## Contract Status

**Status:** [Draft | Approved | Immutable]

**Approval Date:** [YYYY-MM-DD or "Pending"]

**Implementation Stage:** [0 = Planning | 1 = Panel Design | 2+ = Implementation locked]

**Notes:**
- **Draft**: Still refining parameter set, changes allowed
- **Approved**: Ready for panel design, changes require discussion
- **Immutable**: Panel SVG created, changes forbidden (would break layout)

**Example:**
```markdown
**Status:** Immutable

**Approval Date:** 2025-11-12

**Implementation Stage:** 3 (Panel design complete - contract locked)

**Notes:**
Specification locked after Stage 3 panel design. No changes allowed during Stages 4-5 implementation. Changing parameters would require new SVG and re-layout.
```
